title: APT36 state hackers infect Android devices using YouTube app clones
description: The APT36 hacking group, aka 'Transparent Tribe,' has been observed using at least three Android apps that mimic YouTube to infect devices with their signature remote access trojan (RAT), 'CapraRAT.' [...]

title: Windows Subsystem for Linux gets new 'mirrored' network mode
description: Microsoft has released Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) 2.0.0 with a set of new opt-in experimental features, including a new network mode and automated memory and disk size cleanup. [...]

title: Thousands of Juniper devices vulnerable to unauthenticated RCE flaw
description: An estimated 12,000 Juniper SRX firewalls and EX switches are vulnerable to a fileless remote code execution flaw that attackers can exploit without authentication. [...]

title: Microsoft Paint finally gets support for layers and transparency
description: ​Microsoft is finally rolling out support for layers and image transparency to the Paint image editor application 38 years after its launch. [...]

title: Bumblebee malware returns in new attacks abusing WebDAV folders
description: The malware loader 'Bumblebee' has broken its two-month vacation with a new campaign that employs new distribution techniques that abuse 4shared WebDAV services. [...]

title: Microsoft leaks 38TB of private data via unsecured Azure storage
description: The Microsoft AI research division accidentally leaked dozens of terabytes of sensitive data while contributing open-source AI learning models to a public GitHub repository. [...]

title: New SprySOCKS Linux malware used in cyber espionage attacks
description: A Chinese espionage-focused hacker tracked as 'Earth Lusca' was observed targeting government agencies in multiple countries, using a new Linux backdoor dubbed 'SprySOCKS.' [...]

title: Are your end-users' passwords compromised? Here's how to check.
description: Passwords have long been used as the primary gatekeepers of digital security, yet they can also be a weak link in the chain. Learn more from Specops Software on how to find and secure compromised passwords. [...]
